Homepage 







Sustainable Stuff You Don’t See at USC
Chief Sustainability Officer Mick Dalrymple gives an inside view of what steps USC takes toward our sustainability goal.



Outdoor seating 






Take the Student Sustainability Training


Students, get trained on how USC is achieving its sustainability goals and how YOU can help!









USC Sustainability Progress Report
Review USC’s progress from this past academic year around its efforts to make a more sustainable future for our campus and planet.









1.5 million single-use plastic beverage bottles prevented from entering the waste stream
By Earth Day 2023, USC will have prevented over 1.5 million single-use plastic beverage bottles from entering the waste stream since university enacted the ban. USC is on its way to achieving Assignment: Earth’s goal of zero waste by 2028. Find out how you can help.









USC Sustainability Hub to open in Fall 2023
The new hub will be housed in the Student Union building and will be a space for collaboration and research focused on Assignment: Earth initiatives.









Sustainability scholarships, jobs and funding
Learn more and apply

Highlights
IYA “Scrap” Book: Free Materials, Freer MindThere’s no shortage of original creations and tangible works of innovation in a variety of materials at USC Iovine and Young Academy, but there’s also no shortage of the excess these constructions leave in their wake.
Beyond Earth Month: Undergraduate scholars tackle environmental health challenges across Southern CaliforniaUndergraduate students in the EH MATTERS fellowship program are committed to improving the health and wellness of communities here in Los Angeles. 
Integrating Innovative Climate Education into CurriculumIn commemoration of Earth Day, students enrolled in the Health Promotion 448: Global Environmental Changes and Health course, wrote op-eds about the intersectionality of various public health issues in relation to climate change.
Trending Towards Sustainability: The Next Generation of FashionIs sustainability really the new black? Trends indicate sustainability is a rising factor in fashion. 


More Highlights




Making Progress



Sustainable Dining
79% of USC hospitality produce and dairy are sustainably sourced.


Reducing Plastic Pollution
205 hydration stations located across UPC and HSC campuses.




More Progress




USC News
Colorado River water plan could trigger unprecedented supply cuts, ripple effects on key industriesThe American Southwest braces for economic impact as pressure mounts in negotiations over the river’s dwindling water supplies.EPA looks to accelerate the EV transition, but California sets the paceUSC experts flag hazards ahead of state and federal emissions caps and a surge in the number of electric vehicles on the road.USC cuts waste and water use in efforts to fulfill Assignment: EarthChief Sustainability Officer Mick Dalrymple highlights both visible and invisible reductions in waste in the latest annual report for sustainability.Looking beyond the beauty of coral reefsEARTH MONTH: The USC Fisher Museum of Art hosts a conversation about coral reef ecosystems and resilience in face of rising water temperatures.
